articles.title: Maternal Nutrition Essentials for Healthy Pregnancy

content.headline: Essential Nutrition for Mother and Baby's Health
content.intro: Proper maternal nutrition is fundamental for supporting your baby's growth while maintaining your own health during pregnancy. Understanding the essential nutrients and their specific roles helps ensure both you and your baby receive optimal nourishment throughout this critical period.

sections.title: Critical Nutrients for Maternal Health
sections.content: These nutrients support your changing body during pregnancy:
points: Iron: Prevents anemia and supports increased blood volume
Calcium: Maintains bone density as baby draws calcium reserves
Protein: Supports breast and uterine tissue growth
Folate: Essential for DNA synthesis and cell growth
Vitamin D: Supports immune function and calcium absorption
Omega-3 fatty acids: Reduce inflammation and support brain health

sections.title: Nutrition for Different Pregnancy Stages
sections.content: Adjust your nutritional focus as pregnancy progresses:
points: First trimester: Emphasize folate-rich foods for neural development
Second trimester: Increase protein and calcium for growth spurts
Third trimester: Focus on iron and energy for final growth phase
Throughout: Maintain consistent intake of all essential nutrients
Postpartum: Continue nutrient-rich diet for recovery and breastfeeding

sections.title: Global Nutrition Recommendations
points: Eat diverse diet including all food groups daily
Include plenty of fruits and vegetables for vitamins and fiber
Choose whole grains over refined carbohydrates
Include protein sources with each meal
Stay well-hydrated with water and healthy fluids
Take prenatal vitamins to fill nutritional gaps
